body:
> üëç CI has passes üëç code LGTM üëé The [documentation](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/docs/setup/basics/how_to_build.md#-pspark-version) should be updated

Thanks for review, doc is updated
Will merge if no more comment
@Reamer Sure, let me know whey you are ready
Please rebase to the current master. I have added a hotfix.
@Reamer Why this is needed ? Does it affect CI ?

Yes, the CI was broken.
See https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/runs/4175519092

The error message was:
```

Run R -e "IRkernel::installspec()"

R version 3.6.3 (2020-02-29) -- "Holding the Windsock"
Copyright (C) 2020 The R Foundation for Statistical Computing
Platform: x86_64-conda-linux-gnu (64-bit)

R is free software and comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY.
You are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions.
Type 'license()' or 'licence()' for distribution details.

R is a collaborative project with many contributors.
Type 'contributors()' for more information and
'citation()' on how to cite R or R packages in publications.

Type 'demo()' for some demos, 'help()' for on-line help, or
'help.start()' for an HTML browser interface to help.
Type 'q()' to quit R.

> IRkernel::installspec()
Error in IRkernel::installspec() : 
  jupyter-client has to be installed but ‚Äújupyter kernelspec --version‚Äù exited with code 1.
Execution halted
Error: Process completed with exit code 1.
```

I tested the `jupyter kernelspec --version` command and it complains about missing `ipython_genutils`.

> Please rebase to the current master. I have added a hotfix.

done

I also found deadlocks in the application after JSR356 was adapted for Websocket.
I think the synchronised is a relic from the [old code](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/commit/575df6890ea0349314c8f23a5c19c758779ea9f7#diff-dec5ec785ce8a55940664b101105bccd19b2d8c3c335eef5432eb4f8edf063faL69).

I checked the `WebSocketRemoteEndpoint` implementation and you should be right.

This PR LGTM

I've started working few times on this PR but the build is very unstable on Travis.
Part of the reason is also that I don't quite get the build setup. As a Maven project I expect that `mvn clean install` should do everything that is needed. But it fails because some Maven modules cannot find other modules. One has to `mvn install -DskipTests` first and then execute `mvn test` in a second pass.

Last Thursday there was a [meeting](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/x/FJBnCw) with Apache Infra where we discussed how we could use Linux ARM64 build nodes for Github Actions CI. The idea is to use self-hosted Linux ARM64 runner + custom Github Action runner with security enhancements to prevent abuses from contributors. Also see https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/INFRA/GitHub+-+self-hosted+runners
This way Zeppelin will continue using just Github Actions as a CI.
I'll let you know once I have a working POC!
Thanks @martin-g
@zjffdu Sorry for the late response, I was busy with my school things. I have rebased my PR.
Thanks @rickchengx

@zjffdu I've documented the approach at https://martin-grigorov.medium.com/github-actions-arm64-runner-on-oracle-cloud-a77cdf7a325a
If you are interested in this solution then you will need to contact Apache Infra for the token needed by `./config.sh` and to setup the security/approvals. Everything else could be done by any member of the Zeppelin team!
@huage1994 Spark related CI is failed.
If no further comments are received, I will merge this PR into master on Thursday.
Thanks @huage1994 PR LGTM
@Reamer Do you have time to review it ? It make a lot changes on core CI
I have found bugs in this implementation, let me correct these bugs before reviewing.

# detailed action

- when execute sql, all data is saved to file
- when requested, download saved file.
- after four hour, saved file is deleted automatically.
- when there is no saved file, displayed data is downloaded.

I think that the missing tooltip on the three buttons was intentional, because with this change the tooltip is now the same text that appears after clicking the button.
LGTM, failed tests are not related
Sorry for late response @martin-g , this approach LGTM, have you tried to build Zeppelin in oracle cloud?

> 

ok, i see, but to be honest, i am so confused the button function through icon that i  don't chick reckless
so may be can show it like this? one function is  tooltip, and another function is irreversible operations require warning

> I think that the missing tooltip on the three buttons was intentional, because with this change the tooltip is now the same text that appears after clicking the button.

I haven't tried yet!
Before I do it I want to explain something that was a stopper for another project: 

When creating an account at Oracle Cloud (OCI) they will ask you for a credit card details. It won't be charged if you use the Free Tier (and this is enough for testing on ARM64)! But if you want to share this OCI account with the rest of the Zeppelin team then this might be problematic, because someone may add a paid resource to the account and OCI will start charging your card!

If the above is a problem for Zeppelin too then I could offer you a VM donated by my employer (OpenLab Testing) that could be used the same way!

I've setup 4 self-hosted runners on my ARM64 VM at Oracle Cloud.
With https://github.com/martin-g/zeppelin/pull/1/files I've started using them.
But there is a problem with Miniconda: https://github.com/martin-g/zeppelin/runs/4507098156?check_suite_focus=true
```
Error: No installed conda 'base' enviroment found at 
```

I've asked for help at https://github.com/conda-incubator/setup-miniconda/issues/203#issuecomment-992520979
Thanks for the contribution @eubnara Could you update the PR description? You don't need to keep the instruction, e.g. `A few sentences describing the overall goals of the pull request's commits.`
I remove unnecessary sentences. Thanks to let me know.
Thanks @eubnara  PR LGTM

Hi, @Reamer 
thanks for you comment, i modify my pr with take out the code of tooltip related, to plan split two feature,  the tooltip wait for deliberation for now.
any question for clearout feature?

Hi @jasmine-song 
Your PR deletes the file zeppelin-web-angular/src/app/pages/workspace/notebook/action-bar/action-bar.component.html
Please change the target branch back to `master`. This PR will be backported to branch-0.10 during the merge.

Hi @jasmine-song,
I tried to verify your PR.
If I remove
```
    if (!newPara.results.msg) {
      newPara.results.msg = [];
    }
```
from the codebase, it is possible to clean up the paragraph, because the method `isUpdateRequired(oldPara: ParagraphItem, newPara: ParagraphItem)` now returns `true` because `isEmpty(newPara.results) !== isEmpty(oldPara.results)` returns `true`.

Unfortunately, the paragraph is not filled after a run because `notebookParagraphResultComponents` is empty.

I have tested the behaviour with the following commands.
```
cd zeppelin-web-angular
npm install
SERVER_PROXY=https://my-zeppelin-server.company.com npm start
```
Merged. Thank you for your contribution.

Hi @Reamer 
you are right, i ignore the comment of function `isEmpty`, `newPara.results.msg = []` make it is an object with own enumerable properties
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44150070/146316635-a97d1722-dad3-4c7e-ae96-55fc24ea3f0a.png)
so  it is redundant

but what does the phrase  mean
>Unfortunately,  the paragraph is not filled after a run because notebookParagraphResultComponents is empty' 

is there a problem with running after the clearout paragraphs ?

> > Unfortunately,  the paragraph is not filled after a run because notebookParagraphResultComponents is empty'
> 
> is there a problem with running after the clearout paragraphs ?

Not directly, I think it's a different problem. When a paragraph is executed, the result is not displayed until the paragraph is clicked..
But this should be fixed in other other PR. Thanks for your Contribution.
I will merge this into master and branch-0.10 on Monday (20/12) if no further comments are received.

@zjffdu 
I hope you find time between Christmas and New Year to look at the changes. I would like to add this PR to the master branch at the beginning of January. The PR drastically reduces Zeppelin's memory consumption.
Thanks @Reamer I will try to find time to review this PRÔºåHappy Christmas!
Thanks for your update @martin-g

> I haven't tried yet! Before I do it I want to explain something that was a stopper for another project:
> 
> When creating an account at Oracle Cloud (OCI) they will ask you for a credit card details. It won't be charged if you use the Free Tier (and this is enough for testing on ARM64)! But if you want to share this OCI account with the rest of the Zeppelin team then this might be problematic, because someone may add a paid resource to the account and OCI will start charging your card!
> 
> If the above is a problem for Zeppelin too then I could offer you a VM donated by my employer (OpenLab Testing) that could be used the same way!

This is indeed a problem, it would be great if your employer can help with that.

OK! I will request a VM for Zeppelin project!

In the meantime I have started testing at OracleCloud with Github Actions self-hosted runner and I've found some issues with setup-miniconda action but I was able to work them around!
The latest state could be seen at https://github.com/martin-g/zeppelin/runs/4560861885?check_suite_focus=true:
```
Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 2, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.452 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.zeppelin.notebook.repo.MongoNotebookRepoTest
testGetNotePath(org.apache.zeppelin.notebook.repo.MongoNotebookRepoTest)  Time elapsed: 0.198 sec  <<< ERROR!
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: this version does not support 32Bit: PRODUCTION:Linux:B32
```
Embedded Mongo supports Linux ARM64 since recently: https://github.com/flapdoodle-oss/de.flapdoodle.embed.mongo/pull/343

I will open new PRs for the new improvements!

> And the PR is run failed, whether you can force merge it

The failed tests are not related to this PR. Thank you for your contribution. I have merged the changes into master and branch-0.10.
